verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Opening formula for divine commands, consistent throughout Torah.

verses.text: "Command the Israelites, and say to them, 'You must be careful to present My offering, My food for My offerings made by fire, as a pleasing aroma to Me at their appointed times.'"
verses.comment: "My food" refers figuratively to offerings, not literal food; "pleasing aroma" idiomatically means accepted by God.

verses.text: "Say to them, 'This is the offering made by fire that you are to present to the LORD: two male lambs a year old without defect, as a regular burnt offering each day.'"
verses.comment: The daily offering; see Ex. 29:38–42 for parallel.

verses.text: "Offer one lamb in the morning, and the second lamb you shall offer at twilight."
verses.comment: "Twilight" means 'between the evenings,' according to Hebrew; some translate 'dusk.'

verses.text: "And with each lamb present a tenth of an ephah of fine flour as a grain offering, mixed with a quarter of a hin of beaten oil."
verses.comment: "Ephah" and "hin" are ancient measure units; ephah ≈ 22 liters, hin ≈ 3.8 liters.

verses.text: "This is the regular burnt offering instituted at Mount Sinai as a pleasing aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD."
verses.comment: Reference to sacrificial system begun at Sinai.

verses.text: "And its drink offering shall be a quarter of a hin for each lamb; pour out the strong drink as a drink offering to the LORD in the sanctuary."
verses.comment: "Strong drink" usually refers to wine, sometimes fermented drink.

verses.text: "The second lamb you shall offer at twilight; as with the morning grain offering and drink offering, you shall present it as an offering made by fire, as a pleasing aroma to the LORD."
verses.comment: Parallel to morning offering; indicates daily repetition.

verses.text: "On the Sabbath day, offer two male lambs a year old without defect, and two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour as a grain offering, mixed with oil, along with its drink offering."
verses.comment: Special double offering for the Sabbath distinct from daily.

verses.text: "This is the burnt offering for every Sabbath, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its drink offering."
verses.comment: Sabbath offering is supplementary, not replacing daily.

verses.text: "Every month, on the first day of your month, you shall offer to the LORD two young bulls, one ram, and seven male lambs a year old without defect;"
verses.comment: Monthly (New Moon) offerings detailed here.

verses.text: "and three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering for each bull; two-tenths for the one ram; and one-tenth for each of the seven lambs;"
verses.comment: Proportions of grain offering attached to the burnt sacrifices.

verses.text: "with their drink offerings: half a hin of wine for a bull, one-third of a hin for a ram, and a quarter of a hin for each lamb; this is the burnt offering of every month throughout the months of the year."
verses.comment: Drink offerings proportional to size of animal.

verses.text: "And one male goat as a sin offering to the LORD shall be offered, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its drink offering."
verses.comment: Monthly sin offering prescribed here.

verses.text: "In addition to the regular burnt offering and its drink offering, you shall present one male goat as a sin offering to the LORD."
verses.comment: Sin offering accompanies other sacrifices at monthly festival.

verses.text: "On the fourteenth day of the first month is the LORD's Passover."
verses.comment: Passover's date specified; see Exodus 12.

verses.text: "And on the fifteenth day of this month is the Festival of Unleavened Bread; for seven days unleavened bread shall be eaten."
verses.comment: Unleavened Bread festival begins after Passover.

verses.text: "On the first day you shall hold a holy assembly; you shall do no regular work."
verses.comment: "Holy assembly" means convocation for worship.

verses.text: "You shall offer as a burnt offering to the LORD: two young bulls, one ram, and seven male lambs a year old without defect;"
verses.comment: Festal offering for Unleavened Bread specified.

verses.text: "with their grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil: three-tenths of an ephah for each bull, two-tenths for the one ram, and one-tenth for each of the seven lambs;"
verses.comment: Proportions match earlier monthly instructions.

verses.text: "and one male goat as a sin offering, to make atonement for you."
verses.comment: Sin offering brings atonement during the festival.

verses.text: "You shall offer these besides the regular burnt offering and its grain offering and drink offering."
verses.comment: "Besides" indicates these are additional, not replacements.

verses.text: "Do this each day for seven days as food for an offering made by fire, as a pleasing aroma to the LORD; it shall be offered besides the regular burnt offering and its drink offering."
verses.comment: "Food" is again figurative for sacrifice; daily repetition for seven days.

verses.text: "On the seventh day you shall hold a holy assembly; you shall do no regular work."
verses.comment: Festival closes with an additional convocation.

verses.text: "On the day of the firstfruits, when you present a new grain offering to the LORD at your Feast of Weeks, you shall hold a holy assembly; you shall do no regular work."
verses.comment: "Feast of Weeks" is Pentecost; firstfruits offering linked.

verses.text: "You shall offer as a burnt offering, as a pleasing aroma to the LORD: two young bulls, one ram, and seven male lambs a year old without defect;"
verses.comment: Pentecost offering matches festival proportions.

verses.text: "with their grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil: three-tenths of an ephah for each bull, two-tenths for the one ram, and one-tenth for each of the seven lambs;"
verses.comment: Grain offering proportions as previously detailed.

verses.text: "and one male goat to make atonement for you."
verses.comment: Goat as sin offering specific to festival atonement.

verses.text: "You shall offer these besides the regular burnt offering and its grain offering and its drink offering."
verses.comment: Offerings are additive, not substitutive.

verses.text: "See that they are without defect."
verses.comment: Sacrificial animals must be unblemished for acceptance.

verses.text: "You shall offer them with their drink offerings, besides your regular burnt offering and its grain offering. They shall be without defect."
verses.comment: Summary; unblemished animals required throughout.
